newsitem.title: USA: Computer Language sees '97 rev growth about 15 pct.
newsitem.headline: Computer Language sees '97 rev growth about 15 pct.

text.p: Computer Language Research Inc said Thursday that it anticipates that operating income for 1997, excluding amortization and other acquisition related charges, will be more in line with historical levels.
It did not say what its historical levels were and company officials couldn't be reached for comment.
The company said it expects revenue growth in 1997 of about 15 percent.
The company on Thursday reported 1996 operating income of $1,105,000 down from $7,832,000 a year ago. Revenues rose to $129.2 million from $110.7 million a year ago.

"Although 1996 results are below our expectations, we are confident about the long-term outlook for our software and services and will continue working for a smooth assimilation of the acquisitions completed over the past two years."
The company said results for both 1996 and 1995 were hurt by its acquisition program. During this two-year period the company completed 12 acquisitions.
"Effects of these acquisitions have adversely distorted reported performance and may span more than one year before more normalized operating results become evident," the company said.
